hanzi-su-wiki:
歓

Значения

Радоваться, ликовать

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Радостно щебетать, как цапли, птицы 隹 с хохолком на голове, задыхаться 欠 от смеха.

Варианты

歡, 欢
purpleculture_pinyin:
huān
old variant of 欢
старый вариант Хуана
rtega_mnemonic:
歡歡RS
欢欢		歓happy, pleased, glad, joy, to enjoy
  • man with open mouth 欠 like a noisy bird 雚: he's happy and enjoying himself
  • modf. 歡 → 歓
  • ⓢ hand 又 which lacks 欠 nothing
heisig_constituent: delight, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, lack, yawn
heisig_story: Again I cannot resist sharing my own associations. If you've ever seen Disney's animated interpretation of classical music, "Fantasia," you will recall what was done there with Beethoven's "Pastoral Symphony" (the 6th), and the flying horses that figured in it. The mares are bathing in the stream and the stallions begin to gather. As dusk sets in, the flying horses all start yawning and pair off for the night: a perfectly delightful portrait of delight.
myStory:
欢 ходить и дышать - восторг

человек получил 1 воробья и вздохнул от счастья
koohiiStory1: Imagine a spoiled little girl. Her delight when she gets a Pegasus for her birthday... and then like all spoilt little girls she gets bored of it quickly... hence the yawn.
koohiiStory2: I would be delighted if Japanese lacked the Pegasus kanji.
jp_example_words:
歓声(かんせい): cheer, shout of joy
歓迎(かんげい): welcome, reception
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: An arrow is what this turkey lacks. For a turkey, that is a delight.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: A turkey that lacks an arrow is a delighted turkey.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Delight is what Genghis Khan (かん) felt when he saw his turkey friend, sans an arrow.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: He loves his turkey friend, and every time he sees it he squeals with delight.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (𠂉) with the one (一) little bird (隹) lacks (欠) delight

huān
яп. вм. 欢
Radicals: 矢, 隹, 欠  (arrow, turkey, lack)
Meaning Mnemonic
An arrow is what this turkey lacks. For a turkey, that is a delight.
A turkey that lacks an arrow is a delighted turkey.
Reading Mnemonic
Delight is what Genghis Khan (かん) felt when he saw his turkey friend, sans an arrow.
He loves his turkey friend, and every time he sees it he squeals with delight.
